title.native: 異世界スーサイド・スクワッド

description:
In the crime-ridden city of Gotham, Amanda Waller, the head of A.R.G.U.S., has assembled a group of notorious criminals for a mission: Harley Quinn, Deadshot, Peacemaker, Clayface, and King Shark. These Super-Villains are sent into an otherworldly realm that’s connected to this world through a gate. It’s a world of swords and magic where orcs rampage and dragons rule the skies—an “ISEKAI”!

With lethal explosives planted in their necks, there’s no running or hiding, and failing the mission means a one-way ticket to the afterlife! Can Harley Quinn and her crew conquer this perilous ISEKAI realm?! Brace yourselves for the pulse-pounding saga of the elite task force known as the “Suicide Squad” as they embark on a jaw-dropping adventure!

(Source: Warner Bros. Japan)

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Necromancy
tags.description: When the dead are summoned as spirits, skeletons, or the undead, usually for the purpose of gaining information or to be used as a weapon.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Skeleton
tags.description: Prominently features skeleton(s) as a character.

node.description:
__Debut__: 1998

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/amano_akira_)

Akira Amano is the author and mangaka of the shonen manga Katekyo Hitman Reborn! They were born in 1973, but the month and day are unknown.  Amano began in 1998 with a job at Weekly Young Magazine. They also held a job at Shueisha Publishing Co, Ltd.  In 2002, Amano participated in a contest for aspiring mangaka and was one of the lucky winners, with their comic Monkey Business published in Young Magazine.  In 2004, they finally found success with the humorous and classy manga Katekyo Hitman Reborn! (or, for short, just Reborn!), and that thanks to their readers' support. This new manga was advertised more and more in Shonen Jump and became a hit. Two years later, their manga was made into an anime series by Artland studios. 

Their ideas for Reborn!: Amano had some crazy ideas to entertain readers with. They came up with weird characters to add spice to the humor, a story written especially to be unique, and fast-paced action.    

Other works:  Boy Spin (1998)  Hot Blast Baseball Legendary (1999)  Pu Chipu Chirabii (2000)  Monkey Business (2002)  Tapir Hearts HAWK! (2003)  Katekyo Hitman Reborn! (2004)    Colleagues:  Ken Osamu Sakaki  KAITO  Main pine of indigo  Kobayashi  Kasuga truth

__Hometown:__ Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Omiya Koryo High School and SHOBI College of Music

[Profile (One Music)](https://one-music.jp/suehiro/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenichiro_s) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kenichiro.suehiro)

A Japanese pianist, composer, and arranger.

[Website](https://jp.hotei.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Official_Hotei) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hotei_official) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/HOTEI/)

Tomoyasu Hotei, also known simply as Hotei, is a Japanese musician, singer-songwriter, composer, record producer and actor. With a career spanning more than 40 years, Hotei claims record sales of over 40 million copies and has collaborated with acclaimed artists from around the world.

He's married to Japanese musician and actress [Miki Imai](https://anilist.co/staff/105038).

**Height:** 167 cm
**Fanbase name:** Dead Beats
**Illustrator:** [Yukisame](https://anilist.co/staff/258988/)

[Profile (hololive)](https://hololive.hololivepro.com/en/talents/mori-calliope/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCL_qhgtOy0dy1Agp8vkySQg) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/moricalliope) | [SoundCloud](https://soundcloud.com/user-694398002) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@moricalliope_hololiveen)

Mori Calliope is a female English Virtual YouTuber endorsed by hololive.

The Grim Reaper's first apprentice. Because the world's medical system advanced so dramatically, Calliope became a VTuber to collect souls. It seems that the lost souls vaporized by the wholesome relationships of VTubers flow through her as well. In the end, she's a gentle-hearted girl whose sweet voice contradicts the morbid things she tends to say, as well as her hardcore vocals.

[Website](https://www.teddyloid.com/)

**TeddyLoid** is a Japanese electronic music producer and DJ. He is known for producing many songs in the soundtrack of Panty & Stocking with Garterbelt, which charted on Oricon Albums Chart. He is also known for partnering with Daoko in "Me!Me!Me!", an anime music video submitted to the 2014 Japan Animator Expo.

TeddyLoid has performed on stages all over the world, with notable performances including Ultra Japan 2018 Main Stage, Anime Expo 2018 in LA, Canada, Australia, and many more. In 2016, TeddyLoid was named one of the Top 5 Japanese Spotify artists streamed globally.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/GigaMozuku) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/gigankomax/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvq3kUGY5Dbsdkr3DZx25Sw) | [SoundCloud](https://soundcloud.com/gigachan)

Giga is a Japanese singer, VOCALOID producer, lyricist, arranger, and composer. He made his debut as a VOCALOID producer in 2009 and as a singer in 2012. He is also a former member of the Japanese electronic pop co-ed band RΞOL.

**Height:** 167 cm
**Fanbase name:** Dead Beats
**Illustrator:** [Yukisame](https://anilist.co/staff/258988/)

[Profile (hololive)](https://hololive.hololivepro.com/en/talents/mori-calliope/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCL_qhgtOy0dy1Agp8vkySQg) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/moricalliope) | [SoundCloud](https://soundcloud.com/user-694398002) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@moricalliope_hololiveen)

Mori Calliope is a female English Virtual YouTuber endorsed by hololive.

The Grim Reaper's first apprentice. Because the world's medical system advanced so dramatically, Calliope became a VTuber to collect souls. It seems that the lost souls vaporized by the wholesome relationships of VTubers flow through her as well. In the end, she's a gentle-hearted girl whose sweet voice contradicts the morbid things she tends to say, as well as her hardcore vocals.
Originating from [GONZO](https://anilist.co/studio/3/). Currently an Animation Producer at [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
